item.description: In the last couple of years a pressing question has started to permeate the mathematical community: how will mathematicians’ jobs coexist harmoniously with AI as it gets progressively better at mathematics? “A.I. Is Coming for Mathematics, Too” was the title chosen by the NY Tim…

item.title: Usefulness of LLMs as an Author Checklist Assistant for Scientific Papers: NeurIPS'24 Experiment
item.author: Alexander Goldberg
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) represent a promising but controversial assistant in the process of preparing and reviewing scientific papers. They may serve as useful analytical tools to scrutinize manuscripts and identify possible weaknesses or inaccuracies that need addressing. H…

item.title: Optimizing and Characterizing High-Throughput Low-Latency LLM Inference in MLCEngine
item.author: Ruihang Lai
item.description: In June, our research group released MLCEngine, a universal LLM deployment engine powered by machine learning compilation. item.title: Encoding Cardinality Constraints in Automated Reasoning
item.author: Joseph Reeves
item.description: Automated reasoning (AR) is a branch of artificial intelligence that applies various reasoning techniques to solve problems from mathematics and logic. AR engines use clever optimizations and heuristics to solve typically intractable (e.g., NP-hard) problems. Before a problem …

item.title: miniCodeProps: a Benchmark for Proving Code Properties
item.author: Evan Lohn
item.description: It is nearly inevitable that bugs will appear in a codebase during software development. item.description: As AI technology advances, more and more autonomous robots are being tasked with navigating among people in shared environments. Such applications span academia and industry, including sidewalk delivery robots, robotic museum guides, and automated room service in hotels. In orde…

item.author: Leslie Rice
